intro: Dresslerothamnus hammelii, commonly known as the hammel's desert shrub, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, spiny leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in the spring. It is well adapted to harsh desert conditions, with deep root systems that help it survive in low-water environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
